discussion.content:
Selected Answer: ACE
The following files are included in packaged workbooks:
1. Background images
2. Custom geocoding
3. Custom shapes
4. Local cube files
5. Microsoft Access files
6. Microsoft Excel files
7. Tableau extract files (.hyper or .tde)
8. Text files (.csv, .txt, etc.)

Selected Answer: ACE
A. Background images
C. Custom shapes
E. Extract files

Selected Answer: ACE
https://help.tableau.com/current/pro/desktop/en-us/save_savework_packagedworkbooks.htm#:~:text=Packaged%20workbooks%20contain%20the%20workbook,twbx%20file%20extension.

choices.C: Your analysis does not require a live connection to a data source.

questions.question_text: What are three ways to access bolding options for the text in a tooltip? (Choose three.)

choices.C: Right-click on the Field and select Format.
choices.A: Hover over a mark and press CTRL+B.
choices.F: Select Format on the menu, and then select Font.
choices.D: Select Worksheet on the menu, and then select Tooltip.
choices.B: Hover over a mark and press ALT+F.
choices.E: Select Tooltip on the Marks card.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CDE
Option F refers to a general font menu but is less specific for tooltips formatting.

Selected Answer: DEF
D. Select Worksheet on the menu, and then select Tooltip.
E. Select Tooltip on the Marks card.
F. Select Format on the menu, and then select Font
Tested

Selected Answer: DEF
DE obvious right
F : Format | Workbook... 
then you click 'Tooltips' to config font.

Selected Answer: DEF
Tested! All three options lead to the tooltip bolding option.

Selected Answer: DE
You cannot bold tooltip with the format menu

Selected Answer: DEF
DEF are correct
tested, DEF

Selected Answer: DEF
DEF is the correct answer
DEF is the right answer

Selected Answer: DEF
can edit top tip font using option F too

Selected Answer: DE
https://help.tableau.com/current/pro/desktop/en-us/view_parts.htm#body-text-and-markup-in-tooltips
The body of a tooltip contains details about a specific mark or a selection of multiple marks. For example, in a bar chart showing sales by region, the tooltip body may include the actual sales amount and the region name. The default tooltip is based on the fields used in the view. You can customize what is shown in the tooltip by dragging fields to Tooltip on the Marks card. 
To customize a tooltip and its formatting, click Tooltip on the Marks card. 
Alternatively, you can select Worksheet > Tooltip

and the other (one) between C or F

and for F :select Format on the menu then select Font. this same with point C

choices.D: An individual sheet or dashboard in the story
choices.B: A collection of talking points to drive the story
choices.C: The pane where you set the size of the story
choices.A: A collection of sheets arranged in a sequence

questions.question_text: What is a Tableau story point?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
A story is a sheet... 
At the same time, a story is also a collection of sheets, arranged in a sequence. 
Each individual sheet in a story is called a story point.

Selected Answer: D
A is the definition of 'Story'
D is the definition of 'Story Point'

Selected Answer: D
Story point not overall story.

Selected Answer: D
D is correct

A and B
A story is a sheet, so the methods you use to create, name, and manage worksheets and dashboards also apply to stories (for more details, see Workbooks and Sheets). At the same time, a story is also a collection of sheets, arranged in a sequence. Each individual sheet in a story is called a story point.
D is the right answer. Each individual sheet in a story is called a story point.

Selected Answer: A
A story is also a collection of sheets, arranged in a sequence. Each individual sheet in a story is called a story point.

Selected Answer: D
https://help.tableau.com/current/pro/desktop/en-us/stories.htm#:~:text=A%20story%20is%20a%20sheet,is%20called%20a%20story%20point.
